channel.title: CVE Feed for Adobe -- Photoshop
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Adobe -- Photoshop

item.title: CVE-2022-28270|2024-08-03T05:48:37.943Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier) and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious SVG file.

item.title: CVE-2022-23205|2024-08-03T03:36:20.253Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier)and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2022-28272|2024-08-03T05:48:37.687Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier) and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2022-24090|2024-08-03T03:59:23.655Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 23.1.1 (and earlier) and 22.5.5 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to bypass mitigations such as ASLR. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2022-28271|2024-08-03T05:48:37.739Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier)and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by a use-after-free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious PDF file.

item.title: CVE-2022-28278|2024-08-03T05:48:37.929Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier) and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.title: CVE-2022-28274|2024-08-03T05:48:37.898Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier) and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability when parsing a crafted file, which could result in a read past the end of an allocated memory structure. An attacker could leverage this vulnerability to execute code in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier) and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. item.title: CVE-2022-24099|2024-08-03T03:59:23.630Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier)and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds read vulnerability that could lead to disclosure of sensitive memory. item.title: CVE-2022-24105|2024-08-03T03:59:23.688Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier)and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an out-of-bounds write vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious U3D file.

item.title: CVE-2022-23203|2024-08-03T03:36:20.350Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.4 (and earlier) and 23.1 (and earlier) are affected by a buffer overflow vulnerability due to insecure handling of a crafted file, potentially resulting in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation requires user interaction in that a victim must open a crafted file in Photoshop.

item.title: CVE-2022-24098|2024-08-03T03:59:23.677Z -- adobe -- photoshop
item.description: Adobe Photoshop versions 22.5.6 (and earlier)and 23.2.2 (and earlier) are affected by an improper input validation vulnerability when parsing a PCX file that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious PCX file.
